thread.title: NASCAR: Pocono officially adds Xfinity race to 2016 schedule
thread.title_full: NASCAR: Pocono officially adds Xfinity race to 2016 schedule

author: ASSOCIATED PRESS
title: NASCAR: Pocono officially adds Xfinity race to 2016 schedule
text:
Sign Up Text Alerts | newsletter 
DAYTONA BEACH, Fla. — NASCAR on Monday said it has signed five-year sanctioning agreements with 23 tracks that host Sprint Cup Series races. 
The sanctioning body reached the same agreement with 24 tracks that host Xfinity Series races. The deals mean the tracks will host their events through the 2020 seasons, although the actual race dates can change. 
NASCAR made very few changes to the 2016 schedules announced Monday, with Pocono Raceway being one of the only differences. 
The track in Long Pond will host its first Xfinity Series event June 4. The race will be held the day before Pocono’s first Sprint Cup Series race of the season. 
Pocono will also host a Sprint Cup race July 31. 
Other differences in NASCAR’s 2016 schedule: 
— The spring race at Richmond will be moved from its traditional Saturday night date to Sunday, April 24. 
— Dover’s first race of the year was moved up before the Charlotte Motor Speedway races in May. 
— Michigan’s second race will be later in August than usual.
